text: Adventures in the Land of Music is the second album by the Los Angeles, California-based R&B; group Dynasty, released in 1980. The title track was sampled by producer DJ Ski for Camp Lo's 1997 hit "Luchini AKA This Is It". ==Track listing== # "I've Just Begun to Love You" (William Shelby, Ricky Smith) 6:26 # "Groove Control" (Nidra Beard, William Shelby, Kevin Spencer) 4:47 # "Take Another Look at Love" (Leon Sylvers III) 4:21 # "Day and Night"" (Wardell Potts, William Shelby) 5:59 # "Do Me Right" (Nidra Beard, William Shelby) 6:04 # "Something to Remember" (Nidra Beard, Linda Carriere, Gene Dozier) 4:38 # "Adventures in the Land of Music" (Leon Sylvers III, Richard Randolph, Ricky Smith, Kevin Spencer) 4:14 # "Ice Breaker" (Leon Sylvers III) 5:20 ==Personnel== * Kevin Spencer, Linda Carriere, Nidra Beard, – Lead Vocals * Leon Sylvers III – Bass * William Shelby – Synthesizer, Lead Vocals * Wardell Potts – Drums * Ricky Smith – Synthesizer * Ernest "Pepper" Reed, Richard Randolph– Guitar * Gene Dozier, Joey Gallo, Kevin Spencer, Ricky Smith, William Shelby – Keyboards * Harvey Mason, Kenny Hutson, Wayne Milstein – Percussion * Dana Myers, Dynasty, Mark Philpart – Backing Vocals ==Charts== {| class="wikitable" |- !Chart (1980) !Peak position |- | Billboard 200 | align=center|43 |- | Billboard Top R&B; Albums | align=center|11 |- |} === Singles === {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center;" |- !
